page.title: 15Wild Birds of Shoreham,Kent.
page.content:
There are many birds to be seen in Shoreham.In the fields at the back of our house there are{Herons}nesting in the tall trees.In a barn at Twitton we saw a{Little Owl.}Cheerful{House {Sparrows}are common,and can be seen feeding off the ripening corn in Autumn.
{ Kestrels}often hover above the fields staring at a certain patch of grass.If they spot a movement in the grass,they fold in their wings and dive.Just near their target they will unfold their wings,extend their feet and try to catch the rodent or small bird.If they catch it,they will fly to a fence to eat it.
{ Skylarks}fly overhead,with brilliant white chests,brown bodies,and crested heads,singing sweetly.
